legacy.full_text: 'Itsy–bitsy' update: Chinese scientists discovered a new spider species, Grandilithus danxia sp. nov., at Danxia Mountain in south China's Guangdong, bringing the total number of new species to 41 and total spider species to 155 in the area. #biodiversity https://t.co/pRQgVsjBJR

legacy.full_text: American biotech company Moderna has begun construction on its first pharmaceutical plant in China, located in Shanghai's Minhang District, with an estimated investment of 3.6 billion yuan ($501 million). https://t.co/kxE2FOXjNL

legacy.full_text: The latest and 9th round of China's centralized drug procurement program has resulted in an average price cut of 58% on 41 types of medicine, the National Healthcare Security Administration said on Monday evening. https://t.co/W7oi4D4yJS

legacy.full_text: Scientists have discovered the #oldest black hole yet, a cosmic beast formed about 470 million years after the Big Bang. At about 13.2 billion years old, this black hole is also 10 times bigger than the one in our own Milky Way. (Journal Nature Astronomy) https://t.co/bhCtebMbI8

legacy.full_text: The first images from Europe's #Euclid space #telescope were released on Tuesday, revealing a stunning nebula resembling a horse's head, never-before-seen distant galaxies, and swirling masses of stars in pristine detail. https://t.co/rmXUlpmPDQ

legacy.full_text: Chinese competitors at the 2023 International Genetically Engineered Machine competition (iGEM) won several awards, including the gold medal. Over 400 teams of more than 7,000 students from around the world took part in the competition. https://t.co/5Kie5418oP

legacy.full_text: China has unveiled its first compact accelerator mass spectrometry (AMS) with a tandem accelerator length of a mere 1 meter and a full size of 30 sqm — 2-3 times smaller than the traditional AMS, marking a breakthrough in the country's #nuclear #engineering development. https://t.co/BivIASJ3Za

legacy.full_text: #OnThisDay: Wang Yaping of the Shenzhou-13 space mission became China's first female astronaut to conduct a #spacewalk into the universe on Nov 7, 2021, as she stepped out of the Tiangong space station together with Zhai Zhigang, who became the first Chinese spacewalker in 2008. https://t.co/oaU7tYHcbq

legacy.name: China Science

legacy.full_text: Robotic dogs will be deployed for power system patrol during the upcoming World Internet Conference scheduled on Nov 8-10 in Wuzhen, east China's Zhejiang. The robots will monitor 1,260 spots on the set route, halving the patrol time than manual labor. #robotics #internet https://t.co/LNOBgEjWuC

legacy.full_text:
China's self-developed aircraft registered new progress:
- Trunk jetliner #C919 recorded over 1,000 operation hours after delivery
- Regional jet #ARJ21 sent more than 9.6 million passenger trips after 116 aircraft delivered for commercial use
- #C929 enters detail design phase https://t.co/sb1p36kl6J

legacy.full_text: Scientists have found that Jurassic ancestors of blood-sucking lampreys may be flesh-eating in view of their toothed suctorial disc reflected by their exquisitely preserved fossils unearthed in north China's Yanliao Biota, shedding light on the mystery of the species' evolution. https://t.co/3L9Ncg55Z2

legacy.full_text: Italy, France, and Germany on Monday reached a deal to stage the first test launch of the delayed Ariane 6 heavy-lift rocket in 2024, four years behind the original plan due to technical glitches, according to Italy's industry minister. https://t.co/d2OEyGIO1x

legacy.full_text: Chinese researchers have developed an all-analog photoelectronic chip that can process computer vision tasks with greater speed and energy efficiency than existing chips, marking the #first of its kind in the world. (Journal Nature) https://t.co/fNwmRggHKp

legacy.full_text: China will launch carbon-peaking pilot projects in 100 cities and zones nationwide to solve bottlenecks constraining the country's green and low-carbon development and explore paths toward carbon-peaking for different areas, according to a plan unveiled Monday. https://t.co/y8LZihaO6K

legacy.full_text: About 3.46 million patent applications were made worldwide in 2022, reflecting an increase for 3 consecutive years and reaching a new record high, according to a newly released World Intellectual Property Indicators report published on Monday. https://t.co/5XesSaWPyL

legacy.full_text: The winners of the 2023 World Laureates Association Prize received their medals on Mon at the opening ceremony of the 6th World Laureates Forum in Shanghai. Hundreds of scientists from 25 countries and regions, including 27 Nobel laureates, gathered for in-depth discussions. https://t.co/WGzxNQbe9d

legacy.full_text: Kaleidoscopic hues! Brilliant northern lights danced over China's northernmost Mohe City in Heilongjiang Province from the evening of Nov 5 to early Nov 6. This is reportedly the first time the green #auroras have ever been filmed in China. https://t.co/pDaJcksv9R

legacy.full_text: Archaeological work on the #shipwreck of Nanhai No.1, a cargo ship from Song Dynasty (960-1279), has entered permanent protection phase after the excavation work was completed in November. The ship hull has been transferred to Maritime Silk Road Museum in south China's Guangdong. https://t.co/n1dmObMvlZ

legacy.name: China Science

legacy.full_text: China's self-developed portable mobile satellite base station made its #CIIE debut Sun in Shanghai. The 13.5-kg automatic device can restore network connection in 3 mins during emergency rescue and disaster relief missions, allowing 30 people to make phone calls at the same time. https://t.co/D4n6kJnHJT

legacy.full_text: A 500,000-kW #PV power station was connected to the grid and started power generation Fri at NW China's Tarim Oilfield, with its annual green power generation capacity reaching 930 mln kWh, replacing 300,000 tons of standard coal use and cutting CO2 emissions by 726,000 tons. https://t.co/egymraO4Ut
